thread.title: Hitler's Red Telephone Which 'Sent Millions To Death' Sold For $243K At An Auction
thread.title_full: Hitler's Red Telephone Which 'Sent Millions To Death' Sold For $243K At An Auction

author: Vasundhara Garg
title: Hitler's Red Telephone Which 'Sent Millions To Death' Sold For $243K At An Auction
text:
IN History & Culture ON 21 Feb, 2017 Hitler's Red Telephone Which 'Sent Millions To Death' Sold For $243K At An Auction Share on twitter Follow Us On 
Adolf Hitler , the angry man of the world history , is creating ripples even now. He was the German dictator, who had mercilessly killed millions of people and whose name still haunts people. Had you been quite into history, you must be remembering the Crimson phone with which he used to deliver the death orders. That telephone was referred to as 'Hitler's mobile device of destruction'. This telephone came up in 1945, in his Berlin Bunker. 
Read on to find out how the telephone was auctioned at an exorbitant price of $243,000 , which is nearly Rs.1,62,65,326. Hitler's Red Telephone Which 'Sent Millions To Death' Sold For $243K At An Auction 754 396
